title: A Moment of Rest

children.value:
Two bodies, P and Q, of equal mass are travelling towards one another on a level frictionless track, with speeds 
$\vari{u}$
 and 
$\vari{v}$
 respectively. They make an elastic collision. At some instant during the collision, P is brought instantaneously to rest.
What is the speed of Q at this instant?

answer.value:
The correct answer is (b). This can be obtained by using the conservation of momentum; the total momentum is 
$\vari{m(v - u)}$
 for all time, and if P has no momentum then Q has this total momentum and so the speed in (b).
